fields.purpose: A tiny script that automated a boring task, accidentally turned into a $10K side project.
fields.idea_md: I was repeating the same data cleanup every week. I automated it for myself, then realized others had the exact same pain.
fields.tech_md: Vanilla JS + Node CLI. Stripe for payments. No database — kept it stateless.
fields.execution_md: Launched on Twitter with a short demo GIF. Took feedback and added only essentials.
fields.failure_md: Support requests grew, but the TAM was tiny. Growth stalled after the initial audience was saturated.
fields.lessons_md: Solve recurring pains. Keep scope brutally small. Distribution > features.

fields.project_name: Terminal Journal: Writing from the shell
fields.purpose: A CLI journaling tool that felt great for me, but never found broad adoption.
fields.idea_md: I journal daily and live in the terminal. A CLI felt natural.
fields.tech_md: Python, Click, simple file storage. Packaged with PyPI.
fields.execution_md: Open-sourced on GitHub, tweeted a demo, wrote docs.
fields.failure_md: Most people prefer mobile or web. Terminal-only UX limited reach.
fields.lessons_md: Audience-channel fit matters. Meet users where they are.

fields.purpose: We built a beautiful product with every feature users asked for — and still no one came.
fields.idea_md: We interviewed a handful of users and turned every wish into a roadmap.
fields.tech_md: Django backend, React frontend, Postgres, Celery for async jobs.
fields.execution_md: Shipped weekly. Polished UI. Wrote long changelogs. Waited for signups.
fields.failure_md: No clear distribution channel. Messaging was vague. ICP undefined.
fields.lessons_md: Define ICP early. Own a distribution channel. Cut scope.
